Keith (2010) described
Miridiba pseudosinensis
with two specimens designated as holotype and paratype . This species shows features of external morphology, which characterize
Miridiba
. Besides, male genitalia shows features that characterize the morphotype V “ Sinensis ”. Hence, this species is included in this genital morphotype.
